page.title: 11TRANSPORT
page.content: Railways The first train went through Malvern Link on 13th September,1861. Malvern Link station is on the London Paddington Line of the Western region of British Rail(formerly the Great Western Railway) There are eight through trains each day. Four of these stop at Reading and passengers can get to Heathrow and Gatwick airports from there.Tese trains are pulled by large locomotives. The other services go to Worcester and Birmingham.These are Diesel Multiple Units and have three carriages. Once a day an Intercity 125 leaves Paddington at 10.25 and arrives Malvern Link at 12.37.It returns to London at 13.46. It has air-conditioning, double-glazing,and wall-to-wall carpeting.
